title: For Sale/Trade:  Kel Tec Sub2000 folding carbine w/Glock mag
postcontent:
The Sub2K tips the scales at only four pounds, unloaded. It’s a blowback operated, semi-automatic firearm. Its operating spring is located within the tubular stock. The receiver is made of an impact modified glass reinforced Zytel. The front end houses a hinge block holding the barrel and the rear site. This block is securely locked in place by a swiveling trigger guard. The receiver rigidly attaches to the stock by multiple lugs. The bottom of the receiver forms the pistol grip, accepting GLOCK MAGS. The receiver also houses the firing mechanism.

The 4130 ordinance steel barrel has a spring loaded collar to ensure an accurate lock between the receiver and the polymer forend. The tubular steel stock contains the bolt and is terminated by the polymer butt stock. The heavy duty two-piece steel bolt holds the firing pin, the extractor and has the operating handle on the bottom. A captive guide recoil spring with buffer actuates the bolt.

The firing mechanism is a conventional single action. It has a positive disconnector: a push bolt safety that blocks the sear and disengages the trigger bar. The hardened steel ejector is internal. This design, with its long bolt travel, allows for smooth and simple operation and enhanced reliability.

The carbine’s main distinguishing characteristic: it folds in half. It’s an enormous advantage over other handgun-chambered carbines. In terms of storage, the Sub2K-40 doesn't require a full-size gun case or gun safe. It’ll tuck away within easy reach for HD owners. You never knew how bulky your rifles were to transport until you put a Sub2K in your car’s trunk. Concealable.....you betcha.

The weapon breaks apart and pivots at the center-line. To fold, you pull downwards on the trigger guard and swing the barrel assembly back over the top of the carbine. A latch in the buttstock secures to the front sight housing. For added safety, you can lock the gun in the folded position. The Sub2K cannot be fired when folded.

The 40-cal version of the Sub2K is an even more potent carbine, sending a 180-gr projectile downrange at over 1,200 fps. That gives the 40-cal Sub2K a huge knockdown punch, approaching .41-magnum ballistics. It's capable of taking medium size game. With that 16.1-inch barrel and extended sight radius, most shooters can continue to pour rounds accurately into whatever target they are aiming at time after time at distances ranging from five-to-50 yards with minimal practice.

Fully adjustable compensator for 223/5.56 rifles with the standard 1/2x28 threading. I've had this on my custom AR for a year and put maybe 250 rounds or so through it and it absolutely performs as advertised to eliminate muzzle rise. You can get extremely detailed info and reviews on youtube about this device, but basically each hole in the body of the compensator is threaded part way to accomodate a set screw. You can unscrew the ones you want to direct the muzzle blast how you want with the included hex wrench. This would be perfect for competition, target or tactical shooting. 

I am able to shoot sub-MOA groups at 100 yards on my AR with this on, so it is very well made with a good crown on the end. The end also unscrews to provide options for stacking a flash hider or some other muzzle device.

title: For Trade:  MAB model D .32 auto Century arms import
postcontent: I recently purchased this MAB model d type 2 handgun at a local gun show with two 9 round clips and a pair of target grips along with the originals, I paid $250 on the spot (talked vender down from $300). I put 100 rounds through the gun and it fired flawlessly. have not tested hollow points or reloads. I was told it functions best with full metal jacketed rounds. I have decided to see what trades i am offered and possibly get a handgun that is a bit more powerful. these model Ds where used by french military and law enforcement as well as in other countries and honestly it is the most accurate .32 i have shot with the highest muzzle velocity also. The gun does have some finish loss from age but is still 80% blue. zero rust or pitting and the bore is mirror bright with sharp riffling. These pistols served numerous countries for years after ww2 and are known for reliability and durability, comes with 33 rounds of full metal jacketed ammo (only if you also include ammo in trade) These pistols go for over $400 on gunbroker and similar websites. has century arms import markings under left grip. might be interested in a very lightly used hi point handgun and a decently large amount of ammo. also may take a few lower quality semi auto handguns (bryco, jiminez, lorcin, cobra) as a straight trade but only if the trade is for multiple pistols. title: For Sale/Trade:  New Grip Pod GPS 02 Black NIP
postcontent: These go for up to a $100 online. Vertical grip with quick-deploy bipod legs is an economical alternative for applications where the original GPS-02 Grip Pod’s function and benefits are desired, but the steel reinforcements in its legs are excess to requirements. The GPS-LE (Law Enforcement) locks to the bottom accessory rail of your tactical rifle’s forend, just like the GPS-02, to provide the same enhanced control during CQB and a stable bipod rest for precise long-range fire. The grip’s hand-filling contours and deep grooves provide a solid purchase even when your hands are wet. Hit the large, deeply grooved release button, and a powerful spring deploys the legs instantly. Conveniently placed for thumb activation, the button sits flush with the surrounding surface to prevent accidental deployment. Extended legs provide sufficient elevation for a standard 30-round magazine to clear the ground, and will not snag on brush, vehicle interior, or other gear when retracted. Legs and grip are made of tough, injection-molded polymer; steel cross-bolt with easy-grip thumbscrew locks directly to any MIL-STD 1913 Picatinny rail to ensure a rock-solid fit. Accepts GPRS1 and GPRS2 bolt-on accessory rails, available separately. May be used on many non-AR rifles and light machine guns with forend accessory rails.

title: For Sale:  Take Your CCW To The NEXT LEVEL - Civilian Response to Active Shooters
postcontent:
Responding to an active shooter scenario up till recently has been looked upon as only something law enforcement personnel would do. But often the first responder to an active shooter is the civilian that happened to be at the right place at the right time - with the will and skill to defend their fellow man.

You chose to activate your right to carry your weapon concealed for a reason... that reason is to potentially protect the lives of your family, others you know and yourself against a violent attack.  But going to a CCW class just teaches you the law of what you can and can't do -- it doesn't teach you HOW TO RESPOND...

With this DVD instruction class, you can learn tactics and techniques designed by highly experienced professional operators to effectively and quickly respond to an active shooter situation - as a legally armed citizen... the first and fastest line of defense against these critical crimes.

Being able to respond sooner to an active shooter can save lives. In this video Paul Howe will prepare you for that. 

Paul is a high-risk training instructor that served 20 years in the US Army, ten of those in Special Operations. He served as a Tactical Team Leader and Senior Instructor while assigned to Army Special Operations. During his tour in special operations he was involved in several combat actions. One of the most notable was the battle of Mogadishu that was later portrayed in the motion picture Black Hawk Down. 

In this video, Paul takes you step-by-step through the mindset of an active shooter situation. He reviews gear you need like bags, holsters, and lights. The best choices for a weapon platform and medical supplies. Then Paul takes you through exterior contact, room CQB, hallways, hallway intersections, linking up with others, shooting through glass, and more. 

Unfortunately, an active shooter event is a fact of life now... but you can be prepared to take that event (should it ever happen to you) and stop the violence before scores of your friends, family, co-workers or other citizens are killed or wounded.

Order Your DVD Course Today - and Take Your CCW To the NEXT LEVEL.

Here we have a 1911 but not your everyday .45 this has a Federal Ordinance complete frame, Colt series 80 barrel and the slide is an original Colt manufactured during WWI it was made anywhere from 1911-1912. It has an H on rear of slide above firing pin retainer thats the proof mark of Francis L Holsner he only proofed Colt slides during those years it also has the correct internal markings and the correct vertical line sights for those years. It has about 75% original finish some pitting but not bad for being 102-103 years old. Pretty cool piece of American history. I have personally only fired one magazine through this weapon and it still fires ACCURATELY and like a champ. Product Information, Features, Specifications:

This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard.

The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil.

The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Magpul PRS stocks New in Box
postcontent:
The Magpul PRS (Precision Rifle/Sniper) – AR15/M16 Model is a drop-in, precision-adjustable butt stock for rifles with A1/A2 fixed stocks. Designed to offer the fine-tuned, customized feel of a precision target stock, the PRS is adjustable for both comb height and length-of-pull without sacrificing the durability necessary to withstand the operational environment. Compared to the A2 stock, the PRS can shorten LOP by .25" or extend it by .75" as well as provide three-quarters of an inch of comb height adjustment. Machined aluminum adjustment knobs feature positive-locking click detents to maintain position under recoil and allows easy, tool-less adjustments by simply rotating the knobs. Aluminum butt-plate and alloy steel adjustment shafts provide stability and strength to withstand severe impact conditions. Rubber butt-pad offers positive shoulder purchase to prevent slippage for optimal accuracy even with body armor or modular gear. Bottom Picatinny-type rail allows for monopod use, additional sling mounts or storage. Stock includes all mounting hardware for A1/A2 type rifles with fixed stock. 

http://store.magpul.com/product/MAG307/181

I was going to use for some precision AR builds but am now moving. Retails for $255, I will sell for $200. OD Green only. First pic is actual photo, the other 2 are from magpul.

title: For Sale:  Remington 700 SPS Tactical AAC-SD with accessories
postcontent:
I have a Remington 700 AAC-SD. That's this gun: http://www.remington.com/products/firearms/centerfire/model-700/model-700-sps-tactical-aac-sd.aspx

- chambered in .308
- 20" bull barrel with 1 in 10" twist (different from the regular SPS tactical, which has 1 in 12" twist)
- barrel threaded 5/8-24 for suppressor, compensator, etc.
- DNZ Game Reaper one-piece scope mount/rings, low
- Nikon Monarch 4-16x42 mildot scope
- cheek pad/pouch on the back I think came from Fox Tactical? Don't remember but it's nice quality.
- Outdoor Connection Super Sling, quick adjust
- Butler Creek flip-up scope caps
- Assorted ammo, including Hornady Match and Federal Match, plus 2 snap caps

I've had it a little over 2 years, only put about 40 rounds through it total. It's been well taken care of. I don't shoot as well as some people but I was able to get fairly consistent sub-MOA groups out of this gun with match ammo. It likes the heavier (175-180gr) ammo. I bought the rifle new and have taken good care of it. Everything is like new condition.

Firm on $1100 for the package, but I'll shave off $320 if you don't want the scope, $150 if you don't want the ammo, and $20 if you don't want the sling. That's $610 for the gun, DNZ rings/mount, and cheek piece, if that's all you want.


EDIT: The site will only let me upload 3 pictures, and made them all low quality. I took several more better quality ones. I can email them upon request, or I can meet you anywhere between Ozark and Branson if you'd like to see the gun in person. Must see to appreciate.
